verses.verse: A certain man with the name Ananias together with Sapphira (his wife) sold property
and secretly kept some out of the price for himself, his wife also having come to realize it. And after bringing a certain part of it, he placed it beside the feet of the missionaries.
But Peter said, "Ananias, why did the Opponent fill your heart for you to lie to the Spirit, the Sacred Spirit, and to secretly keep some out of the price of the parcel of land for yourself?
As it stayed, was it not staying to you? And when it was put up for sale, was it not in your authority? What is this item that you placed in your heart? You did not lie to people, but to God."
As Ananias heard these words, after falling, he exhaled his last breath. And there became a huge fear on all the people who heard these things.
When the younger men got up, they wrapped him up, and after carrying him out, they buried him.
An interval of as if it were three hours happened, and his wife, not realizing what had happened, came in.
Peter responded to her, "Tell me if you gave the parcel of land away for so much." She said, "Yes, for so much."

Peter said to her, "How is it that it was agreed together with you to try to cause trouble with the Spirit of the Master? Look, the feet of the people who buried your husband are at the door. And they will carry you out."
At once, she fell beside his feet and exhaled her last breath. When the young lads came in, they found her dead, and, after carrying her out, they buried her facing her husband.
And there became a huge fear on the whole assembly and on all the people hearing these things.
Through the hands of the missionaries, many indicators and miracles were happening among the group, and absolutely everyone was unanimous in the Columned Shelter of Solomon.
None of the rest were daring to be stuck like glue to them, but the group was magnifying them.
Trusting people were being added to the Master more, large numbers of both men and women,
in such a way for them to be carrying the weak out to each of the plazas and to be placing them on cots and mattresses so that as Peter went by, his shadow might just fall on some of them.

Even the large number of the cities around there were coming together to Jerusalem carrying weak people and people crowded by spirits that are not clean, some people who were being healed, every single one.
After the head priest and all the people together with him (the existing sect of the Sadducees) stood up, they were full of passion,
they put their hands on the missionaries, and they put them in a public holding cell.
An angel of the Master through the night opened the doors of the jail, and after he led them out, he said,
"Travel back, and when you are stood up, speak on the temple grounds to the group all the statements of this life."

After listening, they went under the daybreak onto the temple grounds and were teaching. When the head priest and the people together with him showed up, they called together the council and all the senate of the sons of Israel and sent rowers out to the prison for them to be led there.
When the rowers showed up, they did not find them in the jail. After turning things over, they reported,
saying, "We certainly found the prison that had been closed in all certainty, and the jailors that had stood outside in front of the doors. But when we opened it, we found no one inside."
As they heard these words, both the priest, the captain of the temple grounds, and the head priests were dumbfounded about them, what this might become.
But when someone showed up, he reported to them, saying, "Look, the men that you put in the jail are on the temple grounds, who have been standing and are teaching the group."
Then after the captain went off together with the rowers, he led them without force. You see, they were fearing the group so that they might not be attacked with stones.
When they led them in, they stood in the council and the head priest asked them,
saying, "Didn't we pass an order on to you not to be teaching based on this name? And look, you have filled Jerusalem with your teaching, and you intend to lead the blood of this Person onto us."
When Peter and the missionaries answered, they said, "It is necessary to be loyal to God rather than people.
The God of our fathers got Jesus up whom you killed with your hands when you hung Him on a wooden cross.
This Head Leader and Rescuer, God put up high to His right side to give Israel a change of ways and forgiveness of sins.
And we are His witnesses of these statements but also so is the Spirit, the Sacred Spirit, that God gave to the people being loyal to Him."
The people who listened were being sawed in two and were advising to execute them.
But when someone in the council stood up (a Separatist with the name Gamaliel, a law teacher, valuable to all the ethnic group), he gave the order to make the missionaries go outside for some bit.
And he said to them, "Men, Israelis, pay attention to yourselves, what you are going to repeatedly be doing based on these people.

You see, before these days Theudas stood up saying for himself to be somebody, to whom a number of men were stuck like glue (as if it were four hundred), who was executed, and everyone, as many as were being persuaded by him were broken up and became for nothing.

After this, Judas, the Galilean, stood up in the days of the registration and made an adequate group stay away behind him. And that one ruined himself, and all who were being persuaded by him were dispersed.
And the things now, I say to you, stay away from these people and allow them because if this intention or this work is from people, it will be torn down.
But if it is from God, you aren't able to ever tear it down, and you will be found to be arguers with God."
They were persuaded by him. And when they called for the missionaries, after beating them, they passed on the order not to be speaking based on the name of Jesus and dismissed them.
So the missionaries certainly traveled out of the face of the council, being happy, because they were considered deserving to be belittled on behalf of His name.
And every day, on the temple grounds and in each house, they did not stop teaching and sharing the good news of Jesus, the Anointed King.
